blog.name: beauty-itself
blog.title: Beauty Itself
blog.description:
Hello there! I am Heather Rose. I am 19 and a Sophomore in college. My current weight (3/29/2017) is 242, and so far my total weight loss has been 7 pounds. My goal is to be healthy. I am also pre diabetic and literally on the verge of it. So i need to become healthier so i can have a better life. My ask box is always open if you need anything, and i mean ANYTHING! Thanks for reading this! bye!
SW-249
CW-242 GW1- 227
GW2-200
UGW-130

summary: My goal is to update you guys on my life more often. This should hella help me stay motivated and keep me honest. I’m not saying...
body: My goal is to update you guys on my life more often. This should hella help me stay motivated and keep me honest. I’m not saying that you will get long paragraphs once a week, but maybe a sentence here and there about my day. I’m currently reading Adventures of Dietgirl, and it is helping realize how helpful this blog can be. With every weight loss journey book I have read, everyone had a blog that they utilized on their journey.This could be biased since you know, they are the only ones who wrote books, but still, it had helped them

summary: 10 College Football Picks Against the Spread (ATS) for Week 5 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: 10 College Football Picks Against the Spread (ATS) for Week 5 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The Week 5 edition of college football picks against the spread is highlighted by surging Michigan’s trip to play slumping Northwestern as well as an intriguing showdown in the Pac-12 North between heartbroken Oregon and surprising Cal. Elsewhere, Tennessee limps down to Athens to play Georgia, UCLA searches for its first win as it heads to Colorado and Florida State meets Louisville in a battle of disappointing ACC teams. Here are 10 predictions for games against the spread.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: Financial education for doctors 101
title: Financial education for doctors 101
body:
An excerpt from the Docs Outside the Box podcast, episode 4: Financial Ed. for Docs 101

Dr. Nii: All right, everyone. Welcome to another episode of “Docs Outside the Box.” We have a treat for you today. Today, we’re going to be interviewing Katie Brewer, CFP, and owner of Your Richest Life. Katie, thank you for joining the show. Can you tell us a little bit about yourself before we go ahead and start the interview?

Katie Brewer: Yeah, I’m so glad to be on the show. It’s going to be a lot of fun. I’m a certified financial planner. I’ve got some fancy schmancy credentials behind my name. I’ve been in the industry for about 11 years now. Started off more in the brokerage world, decided I wanted to do more comprehensive financial planning where I got to look over people’s entire finances, so I went into that and I started my own firm about a year and a half ago so that I could work with people more around my age, like in their 30s and 40s, being able to give them advice without having any sales or products tied to it.

Dr. Nii: What you just said at the last end of your sentence, that is what we call the fee-only approach?

Continue reading …

Your patients are rating you online: How to respond. Manage your online reputation: A social media guide. Find out how.

[Read More …]

https://www.kevinmd.com/blog/2018/09/financial-education-for-doctors-101.html

summary: The dismantling of informed consent is a disaster
title: The dismantling of informed consent is a disaster
body:
Informed consent is the cornerstone of medical ethics. And every physician must defend this sacred principle from every form of evil that would seek to dismantle, degrade and debase it. If informed consent is the sun, then privacy, confidentiality, dignity, and trust are planets that go around it. For without informed consent, the descent of health care into amorality is inevitable, and the doctor-patient relationship is doomed to ruination, oblivion, and despair. It is also important to acknowledge the fact that a lack of informed consent has become endemic to our health care system.

This betrayal of patient trust is inextricably linked to three violations: a rape of the body, a rape of the mind and a rape of the soul. The rape of the mind is anchored in a willful nondisclosure of common long-term side effects associated with powerful drugs, such as opioids and certain types of chemotherapy. When a patient starts a chemotherapy regimen, they are typically briefed by a nurse, who proceeds to educate them regarding common short-term side effects such as mouth sores, constipation, and nausea, while failing to mention any of the typical long-term side effects, such as cognitive difficulties and early menopause. It is the long-term side effects that underscore the tragedy of having to resort to chemotherapy, as they can have a devastating impact on a patient’s quality of life, even long after remission has been attained.

Continue reading …

Your patients are rating you online: How to respond. Manage your online reputation: A social media guide. Find out how.

[Read More …]

https://www.kevinmd.com/blog/2018/09/the-dismantling-of-informed-consent-is-a-disaster.html

This betrayal of patient trust is inextricably linked to three violations: a rape of the body, a rape of the mind and a rape of the soul. The rape of the mind is anchored in a willful nondisclosure of common long-term side effects associated with powerful drugs, such as opioids and certain types of chemotherapy. summary: via Weekly Fitness Update)  It’s Wellness Wednesday again!  I’m checking in for my accountability post this morning.  What I’ve...
caption:
via Weekly Fitness Update)

It’s Wellness Wednesday again!  I’m checking in for my accountability post this morning.  What I’ve learned this week:

Progress isn’t always displayed via the numbers on your scale.  Sometimes you have to look for physical signs of progress, like muscle definition and heart health!  Keep on keeping on, and don’t let the scale convince you that you’re not doing well enough to continue!(

summary: Thursday Night Football: Minnesota Vikings vs. Los Angeles Rams Prediction and Preview https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
title: Thursday Night Football: Minnesota Vikings vs. Los Angeles Rams Prediction and Preview https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The Minnesota Vikings enter this Thursday night’s matchup against the undefeated Los Angeles Rams as heavy underdogs. But they shouldn’t be discouraged; after all, this team knows firsthand how quickly the tables can turn in the NFL.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports
